isis.stitle: TSI 01-09-05 - Painting of Revised Fender Extensions

geninfo.para: Fender extension material on 4300, 4400 models changed from Xenoy to GTX in production on October 17, 2001. In addition, design changes were made to increase tire clearance with large tires. The new GTX material has a specific paint requirement.

note.para: Mudflaps must not be added to fender extensions, except for trucks with 70 gallon fuel tanks and 22.5" tires (drill mounting holes locally).

para.emph: KEY AREAS MUST TO BE PROTECTED FROM PAINT APPLICATION.

caution.para: Paint applied to certain critical areas on the underside of GTX fender extensions may cause the fender extension to crack in very cold weather. Mask these areas as shown in Figures 1 and 2 with a minimum 1" wide masking tape prior to painting. Production and service parts fender extensions will already have the tape applied.

note.para: Service Part fender extensions are shipped primed and ready to paint.

step1.para: Ensure that the part is free of paint, mold release agent or any other coatings or contamination, other than primer.
IF NOT ALREADY INSTALLED, APPLY 1" WIDE MASKING TAPE TO THE UNDERSIDE SEAM AREA OF THE FENDER EXTENSION AS SHOWN IN FIGURES 1 AND 2.
DEGREASE THE PART WITH ANTISTATIC DEGREASER.This will remove any remaining mold release agents or surface contamination as well as eliminating any static charge.

APPLY AUTOBASE/AUTOCLEAR II or AUTOCRYL. For flexible and soft plastics, refer to the flexible parts mixing ratio table. For further information, please see the current Sikkens Technical Reference Manual.
WHEN PAINT IS CURED, LEAVE MASKING TAPE ON TO PROTECT PLASTIC SUBSTRATE.
Re-attach using a washer with an outside diameter small enough to clear the support bracket radius (washer should lay flat). Torque the fasteners to 21-26 Nm.
